tit.cmt: ここでは日本語名をタイトルとしました。

sen.j: おしぼりは、日本では客向けに飲食店などで使用される、手を拭く道具である。
sen.e: Wet hand towels, called "oshibori" in Japanese, are served at restaurants and other places for customers to wipe hands with.
Wet hand towels, called "oshibori" in Japanese, are served at restaurants and other places for customers to wipe their hands.
Oshibori refer to wet hand towels that are served at restaurants and other places for customers to wipe their hands.
sen.cmt: 「おしぼり」から始まる文章に変更しました。

sen.j: 「（お）てふき」ともいう。
sen.e: They are also called "otefuki" or "tefuki."
They are also called "otefuki" or "tefuki."
They are also called 'otefuki' or 'tefuki.'

sen.j: 通常はひらがなで表記し、漢字を交ぜた「お絞り」「御絞り」と書くことはあまりない。
sen.e: The word "oshibori" is usually written all in hiragana and seldom written using kanji in combination with hiragana.
The word "oshibori" is usually written all in hiragana and seldom written using kanji in combination with hiragana.
The word 'oshibori' is usually written all in hiragana (as おしぼり) and seldom written using kanji in combination with hiragana such as 'お絞り' and '御絞り.'
sen.cmt: 漢字表記を追加しました。

sen.j: 雀荘などでは、温かいおしぼりをアツシボ、冷たいおしぼりをツメシボと略すこともある。
sen.e: In places like mahjong shops, warm oshiboris are sometimes called "atsu shibo" and cold oshiboris "tsume shibo."
In places like mahjong shops, warm oshibori are sometimes called "atsu shibo" and cold oshibori "tsume shibo".
In places like mahjong shops, warm oshibori are sometimes called "atsu shibo" and cold oshibori "tsume shibo."
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を移動しました。

sen.j: なお、日本以外の国ではめったにおしぼりを見かけない。
sen.e: The custom of serving hand towels is rarely practiced in countries other than Japan.
The custom of serving hand towels is rarely practiced in countries other than Japan.
The custom of serving hand towels is rarely practiced in countries other than Japan.

sen.j: 一般的なおしぼり
sen.e: Common oshibori
Common oshibori
Common oshibori

sen.j: 最も一般的なおしぼりは、タオル地の布片を水に浸して絞り、適度に湿ったものとすることで、食事前や食事中などに食卓において手を拭くのに便利なように供したものである。
sen.e: The most commonly known oshibori is a piece of terry cloth soaked in water and wrung to remove excess water, which is served to wipe hands with before or during a meal.
The most commonly known oshibori is a piece of terry cloth soaked in water and wrung to remove excess water, which is served to wipe hands with before or during a meal.
The most commonly known oshibori is a piece of terry cloth soaked in water and wrung to remove excess water, which is served to wipe hands with before or during a meal.

sen.j: 布片は巻くか畳むなどして細長く成形され、ビニールに密封されるかまたは「おしぼり受け」に乗せて出されることが多い。
sen.e: The piece of cloth used for oshibori is twisted or folded into the shape of a long bar and served either sealed in a plastic bag or placed on an oshibori tray.
The piece of cloth used for oshibori is twisted or folded into the shape of a long bar and served either sealed in a plastic bag or placed on an oshibori tray.
The piece of cloth used for oshibori is twisted or folded into the shape of a long bar and served either sealed in a plastic bag or placed on an 'oshibori tray.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションを追加しました。

sen.j: 受けを用いない場合であっても細長く成形されるが、弁当などに添付される場合にはその限りでない。
sen.e: It is made into the shape of a long bar even when it is not served on a tray, except when it is served attached to a lunch box.
It is made into the shape of a long bar even when it is not served on a tray, except when it is served attached to a lunch box.
It is made into the shape of a long bar even when it is not served on a tray, except when it is served attached to a lunch box.

sen.j: 素材は布のほかに、紙製ないしは不織布によるものもある。
sen.e: Paper or unwoven fabric may be used instead of cloth as material for oshibori.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Paper or unwoven fabric may be used instead of cloth as the material for oshibori.
Paper or unwoven fabric may be used instead of cloth as the material for oshibori.

sen.j: その場合には、使い捨てとして利用されることが多い。
sen.e: Oshiboris made of material other than cloth are used mostly as disposable towels.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Oshibori made of material other than cloth are used mostly as disposable towels.
Oshibori made of material other than cloth are used mostly as disposable towels.

sen.j: 紙製の場合にはアルコールや安定化二酸化塩素等を含有する液体を用いることもある。
sen.e: Alcohol or liquids containing stabilized chlorine dioxide are sometimes used instead of water for paper oshiboris.
Alcohol or liquids containing stabilized chlorine dioxide are sometimes used instead of water for paper oshibori.
Alcohol or liquids containing stabilized chlorine dioxide are sometimes used instead of water for paper oshibori.

sen.j: 布片を用いる場合と比べて、畳んで収納するとごく薄いパッケージに入れることができるために、弁当などの市販の食品に予め添付して喫食前の手の清拭に用いるよう供されることがある。
sen.e: Paper oshiboris, which can be folded into thin packages, are often used attached to food sold in the market, such as lunch boxes, to wipe hands with before eating.
Paper oshibori, which can be folded into thin packages, are often attached to food sold in stores, such as lunch boxes, and used to wipe hands with before eating.
Paper oshibori, which can be folded into thin packages, are often attached to food sold in stores, such as lunch boxes, and used to wipe hands with before eating.

sen.j: また、不織布をエタノールなどに浸したウェットティシュという製品が市販され、一般家庭やオフィスなどでおしぼりの代用として使われている。
sen.e: Products known as wet tissue paper, which is unwoven fabric soaked in ethanol and other liquids, are available in the market and used in homes and offices as substitutes for oshibori.
Products known as wet tissue paper, which is unwoven fabric soaked in ethanol and other liquids, are available in stores and used in homes and offices as substitutes for oshibori.
Products known as wet tissue paper, which is unwoven fabric soaked in ethanol and other liquids, are available in stores and used in homes and offices as substitutes for oshibori.

sen.j: 接客サービスを提供するバーやクラブなどでは、ホステスやホストが客におしぼりを開いて手渡すのが一般的である。
sen.e: At bars and nightclubs that provide customer services, oshiboris are unfolded and handed by hostesses and hosts directly to customers.
At bars and nightclubs that provide individual customer service, oshibori are unfolded and handed directly to customers by 'hostesses' and 'hosts'.
At bars and nightclubs that provide individual customer service, oshibori are unfolded and handed directly to customers by 'hostesses' and 'hosts.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を移動しました。

sen.j: 客は手や顔などを拭き、おしぼりはそのままテーブルの「おしぼり受け」に乗せておき、手やテーブルが汚れた時に再び使う。
sen.e: Customers wipe their hands and faces with oshiboris and put them on oshibori trays on their tables to use them again when their hands or tables get dirty.
Customers wipe their hands and faces with oshibori and put them on oshibori trays on their tables to use them again when their hands or tables get dirty.
Customers wipe their hands and faces with oshibori and put them on 'oshibori trays' on their tables to use them again when their hands or tables get dirty.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションを追加しました。

sen.j: 汚れたおしぼりは適宜交換される。
sen.e: Used oshiboris are replaced as needed.
Used oshiboris are replaced as needed.
Used oshiboris are replaced as needed.

sen.j: また客がトイレから出てくる際には未使用のおしぼりが手渡される。
sen.e: A customer coming out of a restroom is served an unused oshibori.
A customer coming out of a restroom is served an unused oshibori.
A customer coming out of a restroom is served an unused oshibori.

sen.j: トイレ後に使用したおしぼりは、テーブルに置かずに回収される。
sen.e: An oshibori served after using a restroom is collected without being kept on a table.
An oshibori served after using the restroom is collected and not left on the customer's table.
An oshibori served after using the restroom is collected and not left on the customer's table.

sen.j: 温かいおしぼり、冷たいおしぼり
sen.e: Warm oshiboris and cold oshiboris
Warm oshibori and cold oshibori
Warm oshibori and cold oshibori

sen.j: 水分を与える際に、温水ないしはスチーム等により適度に温かい水分を布片にしみこませることによって、温かいおしぼりとしたり、水分を含ませた状態で冷蔵等することで夏季等に用いるのに適した冷たいおしぼりとしたりすることが可能である。
sen.e: Oshiboris can be served warm by soaking them with hot water or steam, or served cold by soaking them with water and cooling them in a refrigerator, as is done in summer.
Oshibori can be served warm by soaking them with hot water or steam, or served cold by soaking them with water and cooling them in a refrigerator, as is done in summer.
Oshibori can be served warm by soaking them with hot water or steam, or served cold by soaking them with water and cooling them in a refrigerator, as is done in summer.

sen.j: 飲食店などでは通常電気式の温蔵庫ないし温冷庫などを使用する。
sen.e: In restaurants, electrical storage equipment designed to control temperature is used to keep oshiboris warm or cool.
In restaurants, electrical storage equipment designed to maintain a set temperature is used to keep oshibori warm or cool.
In restaurants, electrical storage equipment designed to maintain a set temperature is used to keep oshibori warm or cool.

sen.j: 本来的には、手を拭くために供するものであるが、一部には手以外の身体の部位を含め拭くために用いられることもある。
sen.e: Although oshiboris are usually served to wipe hands, they are sometimes used to wipe body parts other than hands.
Although oshibori are usually served to customers for them to wipe their hands, they are sometimes used to wipe body parts other than hands.
Although oshibori are usually served to customers for them to wipe their hands, they are sometimes used to wipe body parts other than hands.

sen.j: また、理容室では髭剃などの際、髭や皮膚に水分を与え剃りやすい状態にする為に蒸しタオルが使われるが、これも広義の意味ではおしぼりの一種である。
sen.e: Steamed towels that are used in barbershops to provide moisture to beards and skin for shaving are also oshiboris in the broad sense of the term.
Steamed towels that are used in barbershops to provide moisture to facial hair and skin when shaving are also oshibori in the broad sense of the term.
Steamed towels that are used in barbershops to provide moisture to facial hair and skin when shaving are also oshibori in the broad sense of the term.

sen.j: また、この理容室の蒸しタオルを、後述する貸しおしぼり業者が取り扱っている事も多い。
sen.e: These steamed oshiboris used in barbershops are often provided by rental oshibori companies, which will be described below.
These steamed oshibori used in barbershops are often provided by rental oshibori companies, which are described below.
These steamed oshibori used in barbershops are often provided by rental oshibori companies, which are described below.

sen.j: 貸しおしぼり（レンタルおしぼり）
sen.e: Rental oshibori
Rental oshibori
Rental oshibori

sen.j: 飲食店などで大量に供する場合、自店にておしぼりを準備するのではなく、おしぼりを用意する業者によるレンタルが利用されることがある。
sen.e: Restaurants and other facilities that use oshibori in large quantities sometimes use rental oshibori services instead of making oshibori by themselves.
Restaurants and other facilities that use oshibori in large quantities sometimes use rental oshibori services instead of making oshibori by themselves.
Restaurants and other facilities that use oshibori in large quantities sometimes use rental oshibori services instead of making oshibori by themselves.

sen.j: 一般には、その場合薄い透明のビニール状（PEフィルム）の袋に収められて利用に供され、使用後は業者に返還される。
sen.e: Rental oshibori are served in thin, transparent plastic bags (made of polyethylene film) and are collected by rental companies after they have been used.
Rental oshibori are served in thin, transparent plastic bags (made of polyethylene film) and are collected by rental companies after they have been used.
Rental oshibori are served in thin, transparent plastic bags (made of polyethylene film) and are collected by rental companies after they have been used.

sen.j: 返還されたおしぼりは幾度もの洗濯を経て再び貸し出しに供される。
sen.e: Collected oshibori are washed and cleaned many times and are leased to users again.
Collected oshibori are washed and cleaned many times before being leased to users again.
Collected oshibori are washed and cleaned many times before being leased to users again.

sen.j: 利用不可能になったおしぼりは廃棄されるがダスターとして専門の業者によりリサイクルされることも多い。
sen.e: End-of-life oshibori are normally disposed of, but they are also often recycled by recycling companies to be used as dusters.
End-of-life oshibori are normally disposed of, but they are also often recycled by recycling companies to be used as dusters.
End-of-life oshibori are normally disposed of, but they are also often recycled by recycling companies to be used as dusters.

sen.j: おしぼりの平均レンタル回数（つまり耐久性）はおよそ25回となっている。
sen.e: The average number of times that an oshibori is leased (i.e. durability) is approximately 25.
The average number of times that an oshibori is leased (that is to say, their durability) is approximately 25.
The average number of times that an oshibori is leased (that is to say, their durability) is approximately 25.

sen.j: また、貸しおしぼり業者の一部には企業舎弟として暴力団と繋がりを持ち、法外な価格で飲食店におしぼりを提供して「みかじめ料」を得ているものが見られ、犯罪組織の資金源の一つとして社会問題化している。
sen.e: Some of oshibori lease companies have connections with gangster organizations and these companies charge restaurants exorbitant fees as "bodyguard service fees" for oshibori services, creating social problems by providing financial sources for criminal organizations.

Some oshibori rental companies have connections with gangster organizations and these companies charge restaurants exorbitant fees as "bodyguard service fees" for oshibori services, creating social problems by providing sources of finance for criminal organizations.

Some oshibori rental companies have connections with gangster organizations and these companies charge restaurants exorbitant fees as 'bodyguard service fees' for oshibori services, creating social problems by providing sources of finance for criminal organizations.

sen.j: 海外でのおしぼり
sen.e: Oshibori service overseas
Oshibori services overseas
Oshibori services overseas

sen.j: 1959年より日本航空は国際線で離陸前の搭乗客におしぼりを提供し始めた。
sen.e: Japan Airlines began to provide international passengers with oshibori service before landing in 1959.
Japan Airlines began to provide international passengers with an oshibori service before landing in 1959.
Japan Airlines began to provide international passengers with an oshibori service before landing in 1959.

sen.j: このサービスが好評で、日本以外の航空会社でも国際線で熱いおしぼり出すようになった。
sen.e: Since the oshibori service gained popularity among passengers, airlines of countries other than Japan also started to serve oshibori.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As the oshibori service gained popularity among passengers, some airlines of countries other than Japan also started to serve oshibori.
As the oshibori service gained popularity among passengers, some airlines of countries other than Japan also started to serve oshibori.

sen.j: 現在、離陸前におしぼりを提供するサービスは珍しくない。
sen.e: Nowadays, many airlines serve oshibori to passengers before landing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nowadays, many airlines serve oshibori to passengers before landing.
Nowadays, many airlines serve oshibori to passengers before landing.

sen.j: また、海外でもおしぼり会社は、ニュージーランド()、オーストラリア()、イギリス()()にある。
sen.e: There are oshibori companies in New Zealand, Australia and the United Kingdom.
There are oshibori companies in New Zealand, Australia and the United Kingdom.
There are oshibori companies in New Zealand, Australia and the United Kingdom.
